Coben, standing next to her, says he's not sure where his ability to write his many twists comes from. "I think if I think about it, it'll go away," he says, laughing.

"Gone Before Goodbye" began with an idea Witherspoon had about three years ago, but felt she couldn't execute on her own. She called up Coben, whom she had met about two and half years before, to help tell the story of Maggie McCabe, a former army combat surgeon who finds herself entangled with billionaire oligarchs, dark money and a dangerous scheme.

Growing up the daughter of a surgeon and nurse, Witherspoon was fascinated by the medical profession and said at her Shine Away in October that she once dreamed of entering the field, per the Hollywood Reporter.
Writing a book marked a new chapter for Witherspoon — and a new one for Coben, who had never collaborated on a book before.
They emailed, talked, texted or met every day, “We were both completely obsessed by this story,” Coben says.
Coben calls Witherspoon a "generous collaborator" and "one of the great storytellers out there."
"Reese was just the perfect partner. She knew when to push me, when to back off, when to just — I could see why she'd be a great boss," he says, adding, "I actually admire everything about Reese."
Witherspoon, meanwhile, says it was "privilege" to watch him construct the book.

"I understood a lot as an actor about building character, but he builds entire worlds and a cast of characters that all have to intertwine to come out with this perfect result. And he managed to tie up every loose end, which I didn't think was possible," she says.
But when it came to landing the ending, Coben credits Witherspoon's suggestion to change it.

"When she first told me, (I) was kind of like, 'No one touches my endings.' But actually she was right. I went to bed that night, I woke up the next morning, said, 'You're right.' So we made a little change in the end," he says.
The duo played coy when asked on TODAY with Jenna & Friends whether they'd ever team up for an adaptation.
As for whether Witherspoon would write another book?
"Only with Harlan Coben," she says.

title: What Does 'Girl Whatever' Mean? The TikTok Trend, Explained
summary: Why are people writing "girl whatever" on their TikTok videos? What does the phrase mean?
story: Why are all the TikTok girlies typing “girl whatever” on their videos?

Over 27,000 posts and counting have used the hashtag #girlwhatever. The videos take on a similar format: Users post videos of themselves or their surroundings set to Charli XCX’s song “You (Ha Ha Ha).”

The wide application of the "girl whatever" trend include: Horses running by a pool, footage from a Lady Gaga concert, a skydiving expedition, or eating a burrito on a beach. It's even reached the NFL: The Pittsburgh Steelers, Kansas City Chiefs and New York Giants have tapped into the trend, posting videos of their players running onto the field.
But how does this two-word phrase tie all these disparate videos together? "Girl whatever" is everywhere — and so is confusion as to its meaning.

One TikToker shared a video of her approaching the sparkling Eiffel Tower with the words, “Girl whatever.” But the caption was a cry for clarification: “It’s not that deep 🧘‍♀️ (can someone explain this trend),” she captioned the video.
The top comment on the video, from creator Brett Walker, explained their take on the trend.
“The trend is just like ....girl whatever I’m living my life this is where I’m at I don’t care what anyone says about me I’m living life,” Walker wrote.
Other TikTokers have come to the rescue with takes.

The social media agency @media.alacarte, which explains TikTok trends in videos, said you can “use this iconic Charli XCX song to show how you are loving life, despite everything going on around you. Because let’s be honest..it was never *that* serious.”
“The ‘girl whatever’ trend is all about loving yourself and embracing your main character energy,” creator Melanie Martinez said in a video.
“It’s also about leaving the drama and haters behind because the trivial problems and stress that they carry just have no place in your life,” she added.
TikToker Lizzy Lucamai offered another take on what the trend “really means.”

“It means escaping the ordinary and realizing that you were meant for something more,” Lucamai wrote. “It means nurturing your wild woman spirit and chasing down your dream. It means leaving behind everything that is not meant for you, clearing space for the things that are.”

The phrase is “not a diss,” as commenters on this post from an Olivia Rodrigo concert (which got nearly 11 million views) were quick to point out. “To the people who dont understand: the girl whatever trend goes over a video of you happy living your best lifeee (sic), this is not a diss,” one comment read.
Like the slang term 67, “girl whatever” doesn’t really mean anything too deep. It's more an attitude and a mindset — enjoying your life as it passes you by.

title: Influencer Apologizes After Bakery Accuses Her of ‘Lying and Bullying’ in Her Review
summary: Influencer Aurora Griffo, aka Glamorama on TikTok, apologized for a bad review of Arizona bakery JL Patisserie, owned by Jenna Leurquin. Here's what happened.
story: A dispute between a high-end bakery and an online food reviewer has a mess of crumbs all over TikTok.

On Oct. 7, Aurora Griffo, who posted food videos under the name “Glamorama” on TikTok, shared a now-deleted review of Arizona bakery JL Patisserie that sparked major backlash and, eventually, an apology.

“I do not mind spending 10 dollars on a pastry if they are really good, but you cannot use fake-ass ingredients,” Griffo said in the controversial review, while holding a pistachio croissant. “That pistachio color is about as natural as my boobs, ass and waistline.”

She was similarly harsh regarding the shop’s coffee, which she deemed “super sour and acidic,” and its quiche, which she said had a “paper-thin” crust and so much egg, she “would have eaten an omelet” instead.
“Five dollars for a canelé? I didn’t even pay that in San Tro-f---ing-pez,” she continued. “That’s the price next to the Phoenix Airport? OK.”

“I absolutely loved the pumpkin pie croissant, but everything was a little on the sweet and rich side, which some people love,” she added. “Personally, I like my sweets a little less sweet, so I’d rather get treated like s--- and go to Paris again.”

Griffo ended her review with this missive: “With all of that being said, I think if you stay away from the expensive ingredients, like deez nuts, you can definitely enjoy delicious, rich pastry here.”
The Bakery Owner’s Response Goes Viral

Though the review itself didn’t initially go viral, it caught the attention of the bakery, which is owned by Jenna Leurquin. On Oct. 9, she responded in a now-viral video, disputing most of Griffo’s claims, without naming her directly.

“So, we recently had an influencer reach out to us and asked to do a collaboration, and we respectfully declined, because it was not in our budget right now,” Leurquin said. “Then, she essentially tried to blackmail us by saying if we offered the food for free, she would then write a good review about us.”

Along with the claim, Leurquin posted a screenshot of a direct message from Griffo in which she said the “meal will need to be comped including the gratuity” for a collaboration, but that if the bakery accepts, her “honest review” would “highlight/focus on what l enjoyed and be softer/quicker on my words with what I may not like as much.”

Leurquin said she would consider it, but before she’d made up her mind, Griffo came in the next day. The staff recognized her when she came in and were “very accommodating” and “totally respected that review,” said Leurquin.
“But what we don’t like is lying and bullying,” Leurquin said.

For the remainder of the video, she pushes back on the accusation that the bakery’s ingredients are fake: They use PreGel pistachio paste, which is “made from the finest pistachios,” Panettone flour from Italy, and other imported ingredients. “Not bad for a ‘close to the airport bakery,” Leurquin said.
Aafter showing some of the bakery’s preparation processes and noting everything is made from scratch, Leurquin ends the video with a message to all influencers.

“This isn’t just about me. This specific influencer has gone to many different local restaurants and bullied them,” Leurquin said. “The problem is if the next generation is influenced by her to believe it’s OK to bully and disrespect the food industry.”
Griffo did not immediately respond to TODAY.com’s request for comment.
Leurquin’s response garnered a staggering 60 million views and nearly 50,000 comments.
“I am loving this new trend of restaurants getting publicity for outing these influencers, blackmailing businesses for a pastry,” commented one TikTok user.
Referring to Griffo’s review, someone else said, “That was straight bullying just because she couldn’t get free food.”
Even mega-popular food reviewer Keith Lee weighed in on the drama.

“What you do with a little is what you do with a lot,” he said. “If you say you’re gonna be honest now, and you not honest, you ain’t gonna be honest when you get 100 million followers, that’s the way I feel.”
Glamorama Responds, Then Apologizes
Griffo posted a response to Leurquin, saying it was a “bit of a stretch” that she was bullying the bakery, since it has more followers than she does, but later deleted the video.
“Goddamn, someone finally stood up to me. You know, I gotta say f---ing kudos for real,” Griffo said. “I never said that I would leave a good review for a free meal.”
That video didn’t go over well, either: After even more backlash, Griffo deleted all of her videos, changed her username and posted an apology.

“My review was not revenge for being turned down for a collaboration I had already planned to visit and review the bakery regardless, paid or not,” Griffo wrote in the text-based TikTok. “But I understand with how things unfolded, it might have looked like I did it out of spite. That’s not who l am, and that was never my intention.”
Griffo said she gives honest reviews and the folks who have followed her “for a while” know that, but understands now that “honesty without compassion can come across the wrong way.”

“To the bakery, I’m sincerely sorry for any harm my words may have caused. I respect the time, effort, and heart that goes into running a small business, and I genuinely wish you nothing but success moving forward,” she wrote. “At the end of the day, we’re all human. Sometimes we mess up publicly and all we can do is take accountability, learn, and grow from it.”
The Bakery Owner Speaks Out
Leurquin says since her video went viral, it’s “the busiest we’ve ever been,” Leurquin tells TODAY.com. “And primarily, people have just been so nice.”
The baker says that people have been opting for the pistachio croissant most, of course, followed by the pumpkin croissant, an item that was on special last weekend.

“I’m very proud of my community. I’m very proud that I stood up for what we do, and my team, and I think the truth spoke for itself, and the way people stood up really, truly amazed me,” she says. “I don’t think I could have ever imagined to see this in my life, truly, and I feel so blessed and amazed that people are supporting us the way they are, and people have been so nice, so patient this weekend. It’s mind blowing.”
Leurquin also says some of the harsher backlash Griffo is receiving is not what she wishes on her.
“I know she is getting some death threats and stuff,” she says. “It’s getting very intense on her side but in a negative way. That’s something that we never meant to have happen.”

title: 'Blue Bloods' Spinoff 'Boston Blue' Premieres Friday Night. What to Know About the Show
summary: The "Blue Bloods" spinoff "Boston Blue" premieres Friday, Oct. 17. Learn about the premiere date, cast details and where to watch and stream.
story: Danny Reagan is back on the case in the new "Blue Bloods" spinoff "Boston Blue."
The detective Donnie Wahlberg played for 14 seasons on "Blue Bloods" has relocated from New York City to become a new member of the Boston Police Department.
The new show will also feature an appearance by another "Blue Bloods" alum, Bridget Moynahan, who played Reagan's sister, Erin.
Here's what to know about "Boston Blue."
When Does 'Boston Blue' Premiere?
The first episode is on Oct. 17 at 10 p.m. ET, and new episodes will be released on Fridays.
Where Can You Watch 'Boston Blue'?
Episodes will air at 10 p.m. ET on CBS and will stream on Paramount+.
Who Is in the Cast of 'Boston Blue'?
In addition to Wahlberg, the cast also includes Sonequa Martin-Green of "The Walking Dead" as Danny Reagan’s partner, Detective Lena Silver, the oldest daughter of a prominent law enforcement family.
Other “Boston Blue” cast members include Mika Amonsen as Danny Reagan’s son, Sean, who is starting his own career in Boston, and Maggie Lawson as Boston police superintendent Sarah Silver.
Marcus Scribner plays rookie cop Jonah Silver, Gloria Reuben is Boston district attorney Mae Silver, and Ernie Hudson plays Baptist pastor Rev. Edwin Peters.
What Is the Premiere Episode of 'Boston Blue' About?
The first episode features Wahlberg's Danny Reagan and Martin-Green's Lena Silver investigating a deadly fire at a tech company, according to CBS.
A web of secrets they uncover involving facial recognition technology end up bringing the Reagan and Silver families closer together.

title: What You Missed from this Victoria's Secret Fashion Show — Including a Broken Foot
summary: What happened at the 2025 Victoria's Secret Fashion Show? Here's who performed, the models who walked and more
story: Another Victoria’s Secret Fashion Show is officially in the books.
Once an annual event, the fashion show was canceled in 2019 due to declining ratings and controversy. It returned in 2024 for the first time in five years, and again on Oct. 15 of 2025.
The 2025 fashion show was streamed live on Prime Video, Amazon Live and Victoria's Secret's social media channels. Missed all the action? Catch up on the highlights below.
Basketball Player Angel Reese Made History on the Runway

WNBA player Angel Reese traded her sneakers for stilettos as she became the first professional athlete angel to walk the runway. Just days before the big moment, the Chicago Sky player reflected on the momentous occasion in an Instagram post, saying she was "stepping into a dream."
Barbara Palvin Walked the Runway With a Broken Foot

A broken foot didn't stop Barbara Palvin from trotting down the catwalk in style. The model's husband, Dylan Sprouse, spoke with E! News on the pink carpet and revealed that his wife broke her foot four weeks before the fashion show. The actor called Palvin a "beast" and said he had no doubt that she would rock the runway despite her injury.
"The adrenaline’s going to kick on and she’s going to walk just fine, but I am nervous at the same time for her," he said.
Jasmine Tookes Showed Off Her Baby Bump on the Runway

Baby on board! Jasmine Tookes was glowing as she opened the show in sky-high heels that likely made other expectant mothers wince. The model, who is pregnant with her second child, took a moment to cradle her baby bump while sporting a golden look featuring gold embellished angel wings.
Suni Lee Took a Break From Gymnastics To Channel Her Inner Model

Olympic gymnast Suni Lee represented Victoria's Secret's Pink collection in a bubblegum pink sports bra with a lacy bra underneath. She paired the look with pink and blue shorts, sparkly heels and a hoodie. In her Instagram story, Lee called her runway moment "a dream come true."
Ashley Graham Took a Walk on the Dark Side

Following her standout appearance at last year's Victoria's Secret Fashion Show, Ashley Graham returned to the runway once again for the Oct. 15 show and rocked a black underwear and bra set with black wings.

In an Instagram video for the brand, Graham said doing the fashion show last year "was such a big deal" because Victoria's Secret told her they were making "sizes that are truly inclusive." She also shared why she was excited to return this year, saying, "I also know there are young girls watching this that are looking at images (and) watching videos, and I want them to know that I’m happy in my body."
Gigi Hadid Was Pretty in Pink

Gigi Hadid was a vision in pink as she sported lacy pink lingerie paired with a voluminous, textured pink robe. The supermodel also sported an all-white ensemble that consisted of a white nightgown and oversized angel wings.
Bella Hadid Ditched Her Brunette Locks for an Ultra Blond Look

Bella Hadid walkd the runway weeks after she posted several images of her receiving an unspecified medical treatment. Bella Hadid lent a fiery vibe to the runway with a red lingerie look. Known for her brunette hairstyle, the model has been transitioning to a lighter look and turned heads with her bright blond strands.
Behati Prinsloo Looked Ethereal

Behati Prinsloo recently collaborated with her husband Adam Levine and appeared in the music video for the Maroon 5 song "All Night." On Oct. 15, she commanded attention on the runway in a golden ensemble with plenty of bling.
Emily Ratajkowski Made her Victoria's Secret Fashion Show Debut

Shortly before the fashion show aired, Victoria's Secret revealed that Emily Ratajkowski would be joining the cast of the fashion show for the first time. The 34-year-old wore a lacy pink lingerie set and bejeweled gladiator sandals.
Iris Law Epitomized Sporty Chic

Iris Law made her Victoria's Secret Fashion Show debut on Oct. 15, rocking a sporty cropped tee that read "Naughty-ish," a pair of black boy shorts, black and white socks, and white sneakers. The model told Extra her father, actor Jude Law, had a relatable reaction when he found out that she would be participating in the show. "My dad was like, 'Is that lingerie?'  I was like, 'But I'm wearing a T-shirt,'" she said.
Abby Champion

Just one month after she tied the knot with Patrick Schwarzenegger, Abby Champion was back to work and giving major attitude at the fashion show. For one of her looks, the model wore a feathered headpiece that transformed into pearls under her jaw, light blue pants with embellishments, and a pink bra with a mesh overlay.
Many Other Models Graced the Runway
The action-packed fashion show featured a full cast, including additional appearances from the below models and more:
Candice SwanepoelAlessandra AmbrosioDoutzen KroesLily AldridgeAmelia GrayIrina ShaykAdriana LimaAlex ConsaniYasmin Wijnaldum
Candice Swanepoel
Alessandra Ambrosio
Doutzen Kroes
Lily Aldridge
Amelia Gray
Irina Shayk
Adriana Lima
Alex Consani
Yasmin Wijnaldum
Missy Elliott Closed Out the Show
Towards the end of the fashion show, Missy Elliott got everyone on their feet as she performed a medley of some of her biggest songs, including “Get Ur Freak On,” "Work It" and “Lose Control.”
The rapper dressed for the occasion in a bedazzled sweatsuit set and opted for a topknot hairstyle. She was joined by a large crew of dancers for the larger-than-life performance.
There Were Several Other Performances
Karol G looked ravishing in a red jumpsuit and matching heels as she hit the fashion show. The Colombian singer strutted her stuff on the runway and performed.
Madison Beer may not be an official Victoria’s Secret Angel, but she sure looked like one as she performed on stage. Her all-pink ensemble was equal parts sweet and sassy with some feathered wings.
K-pop girl group TWICE delighted fans with a performance
Korean girl group TWICE delighted their fans with a performance at the fashion show. Dressed in pink and black with some statement boots, they certainly understood the assignment.

title: Richard Gere Remembers Diane Keaton: ‘We Kind of Took Care of Each Other’
summary: Richard Gere paid tribute to Diane Keaton, whom he co-starred alongside in "Looking for Mr. Goodbar" and "Maybe I Do," during an appearance on TODAY.
story: Richard Gere is mourning the death of Diane Keaton.
Gere co-starred with the late Oscar winner, who died of pneumonia at the age of 79, early in his career in 1977’s “Looking for Mr. Goodbar.”
“It was the second film I made,” he said Oct. 16 on TODAY.
Gere and Keaton would team up again more than four decades later in 2023’s “Maybe I Do.”
“Obviously, I think about her now. We made a film a few years ago, too. I hadn’t seen her in a long time,” he said.
Gere went on to say he and Keaton leaned on each other while making “Looking for Mr. Goodbar.”

“That was a difficult film, this very kind of raw, sexual film. And she’s pretty shy and skittish. And I was, too. That was my second film. And we kind of took care of each other, getting through these kind of challenging physical scenes with each other. But I remember just how sweet and gentle she was and how real. And I think anyone who’s ever worked with her (is) just like, ‘This is a real person.’”
Gere is the latest Hollywood heavyweight to pay tribute with touching words about Keaton.

“We all know what an extraordinary, unique, special person and artist Diane is, was, and is,” Keanu Reeves, who co-starred with Keaton in “Something’s Gotta Give,” said on “The Late Show with Stephen Colbert” on Oct. 13.
Like Gere, Witherspoon worked with Keaton on her second film, 1991’s “Wildflower,” which Keaton directed.
“She was the second director who ever took a chance on me … I was from nowhere,” Witherspoon said on Oct. 14 while appearing on TODAY with Jenna & Friends.

title: EXCLUSIVE: Even Salma Hayek Pinault Doesn’t Know Who’s In the Cup in New Kahlúa-Dunkin’ Ad
summary: Salma Hayek Pinault speaks with TODAY.com about filming a new, high-drama commercial for Kahlúa Dunkin’ Caramel Swirl Cream Liqueur. Who is in the cup?
story: Being one of the silver screen’s most enduring icons has its perks — namely, free sips of Kahlúa on set.

“I did that mistake while we were shooting and then I had to say the tongue twister,” Salma Hayek Pinault tells TODAY.com with a laugh. “Let me tell you, we did shoot with the real product, and at the end, when I had to say ‘Kahlúa Dunkin’ Caramel Swirl Cream Liqueur,’ I was a little suspicious.”
Hayek Pinault is starring in another high-drama commercial for Kahlúa, out Oct. 16.
This time, the leading lady promotes the newly released Kahlúa Dunkin’ Caramel Swirl Cream Liqueur in the brand’s latest telenovela-inspired spot.

The commercial begins with soap opera types (and a cute little chihuahua) lounging in a living room, when a gloved hand pours “Kahlúa” into a man’s glass. He is confused because instead of its usual dark brown color, the drink is much creamier.

That’s when our hero, Hayek Pinault, kicks through a door, declaring that the liquid in question is in fact not Kahlúa but “Kahlunkin,’” which elicits gasps, even from a little Munchkins Donut Hole Treat.
Our villain, wearing a big hairy mustache, reveals itself to be a Dunkin’ cup. But “Who. Is. In. The. Cup?” asks the ad. The mystery remains.
According to a press release, Kahlúa Dunkin’ Caramel Swirl Cream Liqueur is the “love child” of Kahlúa and Dunkin’ and combines the flavors of coffee, caramel and cream liqueur.
Kahlúa and Dunkin suggest people enjoy the new flavor neat, chilled or over ice, perhaps garnished with a Munchkin.
“I also like it just on ice, especially this one; it’s like a dessert,” Hayek Pinault says, adding that she also enjoys it in an espresso martini, as well as on flan.
Hayek Pinault, who got her aacting start in the 1989 telenovela “Teresa,” says she thinks people will feel the energy and playfulness the cast and crew felt while shooting this send-up of the genre.

“It really does feel very organic and like a family, and it’s so fun. And because it’s also comedy, you know, we mess around, there’s a lot of freedom,” Hayek Pinault says. “There’s a lot of collaboration and freedom. And they come up with a lot of fun things that I have to laugh off a couple of times before I say them, because they’re so funny.”
And she even does her own stunts.

“That was me,” said Hayek Pinault about kicking the door in, adding that it felt like entering a “parallel universe.” “It’s so freeing. I love it. I do have to balance on high heels, on the other foot, but by now, I’m an expert on balancing on heels, so I’m the right person for the job.”

The mystery of who is in the cup will be answered at 10 p.m. ET on the Oct. 23 episode of Bravo’s “Watch What Happens Live with Andy Cohen.”  The cup — and whoever is in it — will be manning the shakers behind the bar.
Fans can also join in on guessing who’s in the cup on Kahlúa’s website and Instagram for a chance to win free Dunkin’ coffee for a year.
But, if you are lucky enough to run into Hayek Pinault before then, don’t ask her if she knows the answer.
“I have no idea who it is,” she says. “I can’t wait to find out.”

title: ‘Love Is Blind’ Viewers React to the Chicken Smoothie: ‘Worst Thing I’ve Seen’
summary: Why is the "Love Is Blind" chicken smoothie causing a stir? People are saying it's the "worst thing" they've ever seen. Here's why.
story: Love may be blind, but that doesn’t mean your romantic partner’s eating habits won’t ever disgust you.
Megan Walerius, a star of “Love Is Blind” Season 9 found that out firsthand when she agreed to try her fiancé Jordan Keltner’s signature smoothie in a Season 9 episode of “Love Is Blind.”

The couple got engaged sight unseen while chatting in the “Love Is Blind” dating pods then moved in together after meeting in person for the first time. In Episode 9, Jordan prepped a chicken smoothie for his bride-to-be.

The comedic scene began with the duo standing in the kitchen. Jordan pulled out a bag of chicken and smelled it, saying, “Good stuff.” He then noted that the smoothie includes eight ounces of chicken.
“And how do you cook that chicken?” Megan asked.
“It’s not cooked at all. Just kidding. I just bake it,” he said.

Jordan proceeded to fill up a container with water and poured in a packet of Crystal Light drink mix. As she watched, Megan made some nervous sounds as she anticipated tasting the unique creation. Jordan then blended everything together in a NutriBullet.
When Jordan took the cover off the concoction, Megan exclaimed, “Oh, I can smell it!” and fanned her hands in the air.
“Smells like chicken. Who cares?” her fiancé replied.
Before drinking, Megan smelled the contents of her glass and made a barfing noise.
“So then we go, ‘Cheers!’ and then you just chug it,” Jordan instructed his fiancée.
After taking a sip, Megan spat slightly and said, “No, uh-uh.” She put her glass down and waved her hand in the air again.
Jordan tried to stay strong and finish his drink, but leaned over the sink and pounded his fist on the countertop.
“That is so f------ gross,” she said about the smoothie. “Oh my God, the texture.”
“It’s like a little gritty sometimes for sure,” Jordan replied as he continued to down the drink.
While drinking, Jordan developed a chicken-smoothie mustache.
“The mustache, I can’t,” she said and they both laughed.
Megan then gave the drink her final verdict, saying, “Eww, I could do without ever seeing this again in my life.”

“That’s OK, you just have to see it every morning for the next 50, 60, 70, potentially 80 years,” Jordan said, then proceeded to describe the calories of the drink (350) and its protein contents  (55 grams).
Jordan then encouraged Megan to feel his muscles, saying, “Feel it. Feel it. See?”
Megan reminded him that he could get the same protein intake from eating six eggs.
“But this is way quicker than making six eggs,” he argued.
“Eww,” she said.
In a later episode, Megan met Jordan’s parents and brought up the smoothie moment.
“It’s been funny. I’m like a foodie and Jordan (makes) chicken smoothies,” she said.
His mother looked surprised then asked, “Are you still doing those?”
Jordan replied with one word: “Allegedly.”
Social media users had a lot to say about the viral moment when Netflix posted it on Instagram.
“This is disturbing on every level! Just eat the damn chicken or make a protein shake,” one commented.
One Instagram user called the moment “the worst thing I’ve ever seen on television” while another said they’d “walk out of the experiment right then and there.”
Reddit users were also quite opinionated on the matter.

“You know what, i’m fine with Jordan for the most part — he is probably my favorite of the guys this season even tho that isnt saying much — but a baked chicken and crystal light smoothie every morning???” one Reddit user commented.
Another called it “unforgivable.”
“I was drinking a smoothie while I watched this too!! I was not okay,” one commented.
What Has Jordan Said About the Smoothie?
“This is disturbing on every level! Just eat the damn chicken or make a protein shake,” one commented.
One Instagram user called the moment “the worst thing I’ve ever seen on television” while another said they’d “walk out of the experiment right then and there.”
Reddit users were also quite opinionated on the matter.

“You know what, i’m fine with Jordan for the most part — he is probably my favorite of the guys this season even tho that isnt saying much — but a baked chicken and crystal light smoothie every morning???” one Reddit user commented.
Another called it “unforgivable.”
“I was drinking a smoothie while I watched this too!! I was not okay,” one commented.

title: Kim Kardashian Explains the 1 Incorrect ‘Narrative’ About Co-Parenting With Kanye West
summary: Kim Kardashian spoke about co-parenting her four kids with ex-husband Kanye West in a new interview on Alex Cooper's "Call Her Daddy" podcast.
story: Kim Kardashian has opened up about the "narrative" that she keeps her four children from seeing their father, Ye, formerly known as Kanye West, and how she has "never once done that."

The reality star and beauty mogul spoke with Alex Cooper for the Oct. 15 episode of the "Call Her Daddy" podcast about how she co-parents with Ye. Kardashian, 44, also spoke about what made her finally seek a divorce from the controversial rapper, the last time he spoke with their children, and why she decides to stay silent when Ye posts screeds about her online.
Kardashian and Ye, who were married from 2014 to 2022, share children North, 12, Saint, 9, Chicago, 7, and Psalm, 6.

"What do you think co-parenting with Kanye West is like?" Kardashian asked when Cooper broached the subject. "It’s not easy, but I raise the kids, full time. They live with me, and I welcome a great, healthy relationship with my kids and their dad, and I think he knows that.
"I push for it all the time, but I also protect them when it’s time for that. And it goes in waves and phases, and it’s a lot of work."
Kardashian also shared the last time the children have been in contact with their father.

"Whenever he’ll call for them and ask," she said. "It’s probably been a couple months since we’ve heard from him. They always knew that he had a big life traveling before and was always on tour and all of that, and that he lives in different countries all the time and loves to live all over the place. We manage it really well."
TODAY.com reached out to Ye for comment but did not immediately hear back.
Kardashian tries to keep her focus on her children.
"They love their life and their routine and their schedule," she said. "And I think just the job as their mom is just to make sure that they stick to their routine, and they’re healthy and happy."
She also addressed the speculation that she does not let her kids see their father.

"Look, it’s not easy no matter what, co-parenting with anyone. I think that the one thing that just gets me is that there’s this narrative that I keep the kids away from him," she said. "I’ve never once done that.

"There’s been so many times where I’ve been like, 'Ah, I just want to show all of these texts. What are you talking about?' Like, we just haven’t heard (from Ye)," she continued. "I beg them to go hang out or things like that."
Ye has accused Kardashian on social media of not allowing him to see the children, which she has denied.

"It’s more of just the narrative that, like, I think it’s all good and we’re living our life, and then I just wake up and there’s all these tweets about how I’ve kidnapped the kids," Kardashian said. "And I’m like, it’s not a kidnapping, it’s a divorce, you know? We can still all be in each other’s lives and have group dinner."
Kardashian said her mother, reality star Kris Jenner, says she needs to give it "five years of being divorced" before "everyone can coexist and be friends."

"Every time he has asked, I will always let them see their father," Kardashian said. "That’s just who I am. If there’s a time where it’s just really super unhealthy, I will say, 'Hey, let’s do it here at my house, or let’s figure out a different time.' But actually when he is like that, he doesn’t really want to see the kids a lot."
Kardashian said Ye has lived in Saudi Arabia, Italy and Japan, and she has "never once denied" her children going to visit him.

"I don't keep the kids, and I think that all that narrative really sucks for me," she said. "And if I spoke out about it and rebutted it, I’m just not that girl online that’s going to, like, fight back and be like, 'Wait a minute, your assistant and you said you wanted a whole different birthday party, and you said your party’s at 4 (o'clock), so we did ours at noon, and now you’re going online saying (something else).' It’s just a totally different narrative than what the reality is, and that just really sucks."
Ye has previously said derogatory things about Kardashian on social media, but she does not respond.

"There has been so many times where I’ve written a draft and been like, 'I’m going to go,'" she said. "And then I’m just like, 'What’s the point? What is the point? Am I going to go back and forth? My kids are going to see this.' They’ll figure it all out when when they want to make those decisions. And I used to be so protective and so 'hide everything,' and then sometimes you just can’t hide it all."

"I never say anything negative about my kid’s dad just because it’s out there," she continued. "Like, the last thing my kids need is for them to hear it from me. And I never saw my parents talk bad about each other no matter what was going on. I do think that that’s just who I am. I just don’t want to go there with, like, fighting back, saying negative things, you know?"
That's not to say she hasn't thought about it.
"I wish I did last time," she said. "I had a good post ready to go."
She added that it's hard for her to stay restrained when Ye has said negative things online about her mother.

"That’s what’s really hard for me, because she loves him, and to this day still does and is super emotional about it and sad about it. It was a big part of our lives," Kardashian said. "My kids, I say such positive things about their dad that, like, North had to say to me, 'Mom, I think you go upstairs and, like, cry at night. Like, it’s OK. It’s time to move on. You need to have a boyfriend now.' And I’m like, 'Wait, what? What? I cry? No, I'm getting a massage upstairs. What do you think is happening?'"
Kardashian also shared why she split with Ye, between him saying negative things about her mother and sisters and airing out "personal stuff."

"Just not feeling safe, not even physically, just, like, maybe emotionally or even financially," she said, adding, "We had, like, five Lamborghinis, and I’d come home and they’d all be gone if he was in an episode. And I’d be like, 'Oh, wait, where’s all our cars? My new car.' And it would be like, 'Oh, he gave them away to all of his friends.'"
"I didn’t know what you’re going to get when you wake up," she continued. "And that’s, like, a really unsettling feeling. Lack of stability was a big thing."

title: How the Cast of 'Murdaugh: Death in the Family' Compares to the Real People
summary: Who is in the cast of the new Hulu show about the Murdaugh family? See how they compare to the people in the series.
story: The 2021 murders of Maggie and Paul Murdaugh at the hands of one of the closest people to them — Alex Murdaugh — are back in the spotlight due to a new Hulu series.

"Murdaugh: Death in the Family" stars Jason Clarke as Alex Murdaugh and Patricia Arquette as Maggie Murdaugh, and recounts the web of lies the prominent South Carolina attorney spun — and the deaths left in its wake.

Alex Murdaugh was convicted of killing his wife and youngest son after they were found dead with multiple gunshot wounds in 2021. He was sentenced to two consecutive life terms at a maximum-security prison in South Carolina.

Authorities have said the double murder set off a series of events, including a botched murder-for-hire plot that officials said left Alex Murdaugh with a superficial gunshot wound to the head. This led to an investigation in which Alex Murdaugh was charged with dozens of state and federal charges alleging he committed financial crimes at his law firm.
Murdaugh pleaded guilty to the state and federal financial crimes charges and is serving concurrent sentences of 27 years and 40 years, respectively, for the counts.

The eight-episode series also recounts the deaths of three people close to the Murdaugh family — Mallory Beach, Gloria Satterfield and Stephen Smith — and how journalist Mandy Matney investigated the family's possible ties to their deaths.
The first three episodes of "Murdaugh: Death in the Family" premiere on Oct. 15, with new episodes weekly until the finale on Nov. 19. Here's how the cast compares to their real-life counterparts.
Jason Clarke as Alex Murdaugh
Australian actor Jason Clarke takes on the role of Richard Alexander "Alex" Murdaugh. Murdaugh was a powerful lawyer who came from a long line of attorneys in the South Carolina Lowcountry.

He was convicted of killing his wife, Maggie Murdaugh, and youngest son, Paul Murdaugh, in 2023, and he also pleaded guilty to dozens of state and federal financial crimes. He's serving two consecutive life terms at a maximum-security prison in South Carolina for the murders of Maggie and Paul Murdaugh.
Patricia Arquette as Margaret "Maggie" Murdaugh

Academy Award-winning actor Patricia Arquette stars as Margaret Murdaugh, also known as Maggie Murdaugh. Maggie Murdaugh was the wife of Alex Murdaugh and the mother of Buster and Paul Murdaugh until she was murdered by Alex Murdaugh in 2021.
Johnny Berchtold as Paul Murdaugh
Paul Murdaugh, played by Johnny Berchtold, was the youngest son of Alex and Maggie Murdaugh.

In 2019, he was involved in a boat crash on the Beaufort River in South Carolina that left his friend Mallory Beach dead. Paul Murdaugh was charged with three felony counts of boating under the influence in connection with the incident, and pleaded not guilty, NBC affiliate WSAV reported.

On June 7, 2021, Paul Murdaugh was shot and killed by his father, Alex Murdaugh. The boating charges against Paul Murdaugh were dropped in August 2021 after the South Carolina Attorney General’s Office received his death certificate, WSAV reported.
Will Harrison as Buster Murdaugh

Will Harrison, whom viewers might recognize from the Bob Dylan  biopic "A Complete Unknown" or the Prime Video series "Daisy Jones & the Six," plays Richard Alexander Murdaugh Jr., known as Buster, the eldest son of Alex and Maggie Murdaugh.
Brittany Snow as Mandy Matney

Brittany Snow, known for her roles in "The Hunting Wives," the "Pitch Perfect" series and more, portrays Mandy Matney, a journalist who covered the Murdaugh case and later created the "Murdaugh Murders" podcast.
Kathleen Wilhoite as Gloria Satterfield

Gloria Satterfield was the Murdaugh family's longtime housekeeper until she died at the Murdaugh family home in 2018 in what was described during a 911 call as a fall. Kathleen Wilhoite is portraying Satterfield in "Murdaugh: Death in the Family."
J. Smith-Cameron as Marian Proctor
J. Smith-Cameron takes on the role of Marian Proctor, Maggie Murdaugh's sister and a key witness in Alex Murdaugh's murder trial, as she spoke with her sister on the day of the murders.
Gerald McRaney as Randolph Murdaugh
Randolph Murdaugh III, the father of Alex Murdaugh, will be played by Gerald McRaney.
Noah Emmerich as Randy Murdaugh
Noah Emmerich plays Randolph "Randy" Murdaugh IV, the older brother of Alex Murdaugh and a partner at the family law firm.

title: A ‘Parent Trap’ Reunion! Dennis Quaid, Lisa Ann Walter Support Elaine Hendrix on ‘DWTS’
summary: Elaine Hendrix's "Parent Trap" co-stars Lisa Ann Walter and Dennis Quaid were on hand during "Dedication Night" of “Dancing With the Stars.”
story: Elaine Hendrix got some support from a pair of dear friends and co-stars on and off the dance floor during the Oct. 14 episode of “Dancing With the Stars.”

Dennis Quaid and Lisa Ann Walter, who starred alongside Hendrix in 1998's “The Parent Trap,” were on hand. Walter, who is best friends with Hendrix, even joined her and pro partner Alan Bersten for their foxtrot. They performed to “This Will Be (An Everlasting Love)” by Natalie Cole, which is also part of the film's soundtrack.

The performance came during the show’s “Dedication Night,” in which each of the 10 remaining celebrities honored someone close to them. For the first time in the show's history, the person being honored joined the celebrity on the ballroom floor.

Hendrix dedicated her performance to Walter, who appeared on the dance floor about 25 seconds into the duo’s routine, turning them into a trio. She even hugged Hendrix at one point. Their efforts landed them a score of 30/40 and was one of the night's '90s-centric moments, along with Danielle Fishel bringing out "Boy Meets World" co-star William Daniels for her jive.
After the show, Hendrix gushed about her relationship with Walter.

“Lisa has been there for me through every part of my life, since the day we met, when we filmed ‘The Parent Trap’ almost 30 years ago, which is crazy to think about,” she told “Extra” while standing with Walter and Quaid.
“I cannot do life without her,” she continued.
Walter downplayed her moves on the dance floor.
“Elaine is the dancer. I am just a lesser partner,” she said while chuckling and noting she loves to dance.
Quaid was also moved watching the duo dance.
“You could really feel your relationship out there. It was so much fun, and I’m really proud of you,” he said.
The “Abbott Elementary” star also gushed about how good a friend Hendrix continues to be, even as she devotes a lot of time to “Dancing With the Stars.”
“Elaine came flying over here from rehearsal so that she could be with me and hold me while I had to let my dog go,” she said.
Walter also made sure to share some love for Quaid.

“When we were shooting ‘The Parent Trap,’ we were both newer in the movie business,” she said, referring to herself and Hendrix. “And he was so supportive and so giving and generous with all the work that we did, telling us how great we were. It’s not always like that, and he’s like that.”

title: Britney Spears' Team Responds to Kevin Federline's Comments About Her Behavior
summary: Britney Spears' team responded to excerpts from her ex-husband Kevin Federline's upcoming memoir, "You Thought You Knew," about her behavior as a mom.
story: Britney Spears' team responded to excerpts from her ex-husband Kevin Federline's upcoming memoir, stating he is concerned about what he called the pop star's erratic actions since she was released from her conservatorship in 2021.

Federline wrote in his upcoming memoir, "You Thought You Knew," that he has mostly learned of his ex-wife's behavior from their two sons, according to excerpts published in The New York Times on Oct. 14. (NBC News has not independently verified the quotes from the book.)
A representative for Spears addressed Federline's comments in a statement to NBC News on Oct. 15.

“With news from Kevin’s book breaking, once again he and others are profiting off her and sadly it comes after child support has ended with Kevin,” the rep said. “All she cares about are her kids, Sean Preston and Jayden James and their well-being during this sensationalism. She detailed her journey in her memoir.”

Spears and Federline married in 2004, and finalized their divorce in 2007. According to court records obtained by NBC News, Spears paid between $20,000 and $40,000 per month in child support for their sons, Sean Preston, 20, and Jayden James, 19.
Federline wrote in the memoir, which comes out Oct. 21, that his sons once told him when they were teenagers they didn't want to return to Spears' home for several reasons, according to the Times.

“They would awaken sometimes at night to find her standing silently in the doorway, watching them sleep — ‘Oh, you’re awake?’ — with a knife in her hand,” he wrote, according to the Times. “Then she’d turn around and pad off without explanation.”
Federline said in an interview with the Times that he hasn't spoken to Spears in years, but he has become concerned about her due to what he hears from his sons.
“The truth is, this situation with Britney feels like it’s racing toward something irreversible,” he wrote in the book, according to the Times.

“It’s become impossible to pretend everything’s OK,” he added, per the Times. “From where I sit, the clock is ticking, and we’re getting close to the 11th hour. Something bad is going to happen if things don’t change, and my biggest fear is that our sons will be left holding the pieces.”
Federline told the Times he had not discussed the contents of his memoir with Spears, whom he once was a backup dancer for.

“I’ve never, ever, once, been against Britney,” Federline said. “I’ve only tried to help my sons have an incredible relationship with their mother. And it’s hard because when I really reflect on everything that’s happened — my kids do not know the woman that I married. And I’ve spent two decades trying to bridge that gap.”
In an Oct. 14 interview with "Entertainment Tonight," Federline denied writing the memoir for money.
"I’m absolutely, as a father, terrified that one day I might wake up and my sons are going to have to deal with the unimaginable," Federline said.

In 2021, Spears was freed from her 13-year conservatorship after months of court hearings and years of public support from her fans, following several documentaries that investigated the pop star's life.
Spears wrote in her 2023 memoir, “The Woman in Me,” that while she was under the conservatorship she felt like she “became a robot.”

“But not just a robot — a sort of child-robot. I had been so infantilized that I was losing pieces of what made me feel like myself,” Spears wrote. “The conservatorship stripped me of my womanhood, made me into a child. I became more of an entity than a person onstage. I had always felt music in my bones and my blood; they stole that from me.”

Spears' memoir is being adapted into a biopic by Universal Pictures, with "Wicked" director Jon M. Chu and producer Marc Platt attached, according to NBC News. (TODAY and Universal Pictures are owned by the same parent company, NBCUniversal.)
Spears seemingly referenced the project in a post on X in 2024.
"Excited to share with my fans that I’ve been working on a secret project with #MarcPlatt. He’s always made my favorite movies … stay tuned," she said, adding a rose and camera emoji.

title: Sheryl Lee Ralph Recites the Powerful Motto She Lives By — And Nearly Moves Hoda to Tears
summary: Sheryl Lee Ralph tells Hoda Kotb on the "Making Space" podcast that she lives by lyrics featured in the song "Dreamgirls" and says joy is her "strong suit."
story: New episodes of Hoda’s podcast are available every Wednesday — just search “Making Space” wherever you get your podcasts, or click here.
It's been nearly 45 years since Sheryl Lee Ralph starred in "Dreamgirls" on Broadway, but the experience left a lasting impact on her.
In a new episode of Hoda Kotb's "Making Space" podcast, the former TODAY co-anchor sits down with the actor and singer and asks how the role impacted Ralph's life.

“It changed everything for me, because first of all, what happened was there were so many little 9- and 10-year-old girls, little Black girls, in the audience (going to) their first musical. They look up onstage, and they’re looking at me, and Loretta (Devine) and Debbie (Burrell), and they’re like, ‘We’ve never seen anything like this,’” she recalled.
Ralph went on to say that she and her co-stars were like “a living, breathing Barbie doll” for their young fans.
The Broadway production premiered in 1981, but Ralph still hears from fans who were touched to see several young Black women onstage in a story about chasing dreams.

“I think about that, and it’s like, that was life-changing for a generation or two. And the way gay men who saw the show talked about whatever they felt watching the show, I mean, it’s just — it was revelatory for so many people to see this show and talk about dreams and what it takes to fight for yourself within your dreams, especially when everybody’s telling you it's not you, it can’t happen to you,” Ralph explained.
Ralph then recited lyrics from the song "Dreamgirls" and said the words have become a lifelong motto for her.
"'I’m your dreamgirl. Dreamgirls will never leave you. All you’ve got to do is dream, baby. I’ll be there,'" she said. "And I live by that to this day."
"I could cry," Hoda responded, gesturing at her eyes.
During their conversation, Hoda also complimented Ralph on her energy, and the "Abbott Elementary" star said a friend once described her as "the happiest person ever."
"She sent along some pictures of me, and I said, 'Actually, you are quite correct. Joy is my strong suit,'" she said.
"Joy is your thing?" Hoda, who recently released a book about joy, asked.

"Joy is my strong suit," Ralph said. "Oh God, yes. You know what I think about every time I wake up in the morning? I know for a fact, millions didn’t make it. But I am one of those that did. And on top of it, I woke up in my right mind. How about that?"
Hoda was curious to know if joy has always been a part of Ralph's personality.

"I would have to say that I was built on joy, because as a child of the '60s, you know, there were so many horrible things going on in the '60s, and your parents really had to fortify you with strength," Ralph, 68, said. "They had to give you hope. They had to show you joy to let you know that yes, there is a future. And yes, there’s definitely something to live for, and you can be a part of what it is you want to see in the future."

title: 'DWTS' Dedication Night Ends With Major and Emotional Surprise
summary: “Dancing With the Stars” Dedication Night was an emotional one for the celebrities and viewers. The co-hosts also announced surprise news.
story: “Dancing With the Stars” Dedication Night was an emotional one for the celebrities and viewers.

The Oct. 14 episode of “DWTS” saw the 10 remaining couples pay tribute to their family and friends with their touching routines. For the first time, the person they were honoring accompanied them on the ballroom floor for an extra special and moving moment.

Week 5 included the addition of two-time Mirrorball champion Kym Johnson as a guest judge. The troupe also entertained the crowd with routines to “Mystical Magical” by Benson Boone and “Man I Need” by Olivia Dean. Additional performances included “Green Light” by Lorde, choreographed by Jenna Johnson and Britt Stewart, and “Back On 74”  by Jungle, choreographed by Brandon Armstrong.
Last week, Hilaria Baldwin and partner Gleb Savchenko were eliminated during Disney Night.
Here’s a recap of what went down on the “DWTS” fifth episode, including the dances, scores from judges  Johnson, Carrie Ann Inaba, Bruno Tonioli and Derek Hough, and who was (or wasn't) eliminated.
What Did Each Star Dance to and What Was Their Score?

title: Danielle Fishel Brings Out William Daniels for 'Boy Meets World' Dedication Dance on 'DWTS'
summary: William Daniels’ “Dancing With the Stars” appearance pulled at the heartstrings.
story: William Daniels’ “Dancing With the Stars” appearance pulled at the heartstrings.
The actor, famously known for his Mr. Feeny role on “Boy Meets World,” was Danielle Fishel’s special guest on the Oct. 14 episode of “DWTS.”

The Week 5 theme was Dedication Night, an emotional one that  sees the celebrities pay tribute to someone who's made an impact in their lives. For the first time, the special person also accompanied them on the dance floor.
At 98 years young, Daniels joined Fishel, who portrayed Topanga on the series, during her jive routine set to the “Boy Meets World” theme song by Twenty Cent Crush featuring Phil Rosenthal.
Ahead of their performance with partner Pasha Pashkov, Fishel spoke about her lifelong friendship with Daniels.

“He’s just somebody I have looked up to as a man, as an actor, as a professional,” Fishel said, explaining how he’s shaped her career. “It’s been over 30 years since we met and I know how proud he is of me. He really means a lot to me.”
Daniels, via FaceTime, added how proud he was and continues to be of Fishel.

They then took over the ballroom, with the camera centering on Daniels standing in front of a desk. The set appeared to look like an office like one would see on "Boy Meets World." As Fishel and Pashkov joined Daniels and shook and shimmed, she gave him a hug.
Fishel and Pashkov continued with their energetic jive that got the crowd hyped. They then returned to the top of the stage where Daniels was now seated at the desk to end the routine.
They received a 28 out of 40 after the judges applauded and critiqued the routine.

For seven seasons from 1993 to 2000, Daniels and Fishel co-starred in the ABC sitcom that centered around the life of Cory Matthews (Ben Savage), his family, best friend Shawn Hunter (Rider Strong) and girlfriend-turned-wife Topanga. The show started when Cory, Shawn and Topanga were in six grade, up until their college years, with their teacher Mr. Feeny always by their side.

The nostalgia continued as "Boy Meets World" alum Will Friedle (Eric Matthews), Betsy Randle (Amy Matthews), William Russ (Alan Matthews), Trina McGee (Angela Moore), Matthew Lawrence (Jack Hunter) and Alex Désert (Eli Williams) were in attendance.
Daniels' wife, Bonnie Bartlett, who also appeared in the show as Lila Bolander, was also cheering her husband on. The two have been married since 1951.

Mr. Feeny's relationship with his neighbors and students has always been one that fans admired. In the series finale, he continues to impart his wisdom to the young adults, before ending the show by telling them: “I love you all. Class dismissed.”

title: Dylan Efron Dances With Little Sister Olivia to Brother Zac's Song for ‘DWTS’ Dedication Night
summary: Dylan Efron turned the "Dancing With the Stars" ballroom into a family affair when he dedicated his dance to sister Olivia and danced to Zac Efron's song "Rewrite the Stars."
story: Dylan Efron turned the ballroom into a family affair and the audience into a puddle of tears during his latest performance on “Dancing With the Stars.”

For Week 5 of the dancing competition show, “Dedication Night,” each of the 10 remaining celebrities performed a sentimental routine for a friend or family member. Then, in a first for the long-running series, the stars were joined by their loved ones on the ballroom floor.

“The Traitors” Season 3 star, who was coming off his most successful week yet after receiving a 23 out of 30 from the judges for his quickstep, danced a contemporary routine with partner Daniella Karagach on the Oct. 14 episode. Although the song, “Rewrite the Stars” from “The Greatest Showman,” was a nod to older brother Zac Efron, Dylan Efron dedicated the sweet performance to his little sister, Olivia.
Before Dylan Efron and Karagach stepped on the ballroom floor, their rehearsal footage showed the reality star talking about his siblings.
“I wasn’t expecting to be a big brother,” he said, noting their 30-year difference. He said that after she was born, they were “immediately inseparable.”
“I want to show her to live life with confidence,” he continued, adding that Zac Efron was always there for him and he wants to be that for Olivia.
Olivia, in a pink leotard, also spoke about her big brother, expressing how much she loves him.
“I just like being with Dylan. He’s my best friend and I just feel like I’m free with him,” she said, with Dylan Efron calling their love “authentic.”
The dance kicked off with Dylan Efron and Olivia, who will turn 6 in December, having their own moment on stage. He held her up and twirled her around.
As the descended the steps, she ran off to the side and Dylan Efron was then joined by Karagach.
The two then delivered a powerhouse performance that included lifts and amazing showmanship. The routine ended with Olivia running back into her big brother's arms.
After rave reviews from the  judges, they were awarded a 36 out of 40.

Although she just graced the dance floor for the first time, Olivia has been spotted in the ballroom frequently this season cheering on her big brother. For his first performance, Dylan Efron told TODAY.com that his mom, dad, younger brother Henry and Olivia were all in attendance to support him.

“The first person I called (after the dance) was my mom because she was in the stands, but she didn’t know that she could see me after the show,” he shared. “I was expecting to see her, and then she wasn’t there. So I just called her to say, thank you for coming. And that was after I saw my dad, and my little brother and sister.”

title: Robert Irwin and Mom Terri Have Emotional Moment During 'DWTS' Dedication Dance
summary: The “Dancing With the Stars” ballroom was in tears after Robert Irwin’s dance with his mother, Terri Irwin.
story: The “Dancing With the Stars” ballroom was in tears after Robert Irwin’s dance with his mother, Terri Irwin.
The Oct. 14 episode of “DWTS” was Dedication Night, where the celebrities honored their family or friends with a moving routine that included that special person.
The 21-year-old Australian wildlife conservationist and pro partner Witney Carson danced a contemporary routine to “You’ll Be In My Heart” by Phil Collins.

The two kicked off the emotional number, perfectly in sync as they performed the lyrical routine. The emotions were high as they took over the dance floor. As the performance came to an end, Carson departed and Terri Irwin, in a yellow dress, appeared. She held her son's hand as he twirled her.
They finished by embracing each other, visibly emotional.
Ahead of the performance, Robert Irwin spoke about losing his father, Steve Irwin, when he was almost 3 years old, and how his mother made sure to always be there for him and sister Bindi Irwin.

Steve Irwin died at the age of 44 after being pierced in the chest by a stingray's barb while filming an underwater documentary. The Irwins have continued to keep his memory alive with their wildlife conservation work.
“I was 2 when I lost dad,” Robert Irwin said, getting emotional. He said that he’s “never been about to capture the feeling of gratitude that I feel for her.”
He added that at times, “I just wish that my dad was there, but she was there — and that was enough.”
“I struggle a lot with losing dad and she always made sure my dad was present in our lives. I want her to know how proud my dad would be of her,” he said.
Terri Irwin also spoke about her husband’s death, saying, “After we lost Steve it was difficult to smile again, for quite a while.”
She added that because of her children, “I could get up every morning. So every day I’m a proud mama.”
Following their routine, the judges were in tears themselves.  Bruno Tonioli  called it a “true expression of love,” with Carrie Ann Inaba praising Terri Irwin.

Derek Hough was also in tears, expressing how much love he has for their family. Hough won Season 21 of “DWTS” with Bindi Irwin in 2015. She was also in the audience with husband Chandler Powell and daughter Grace.
The judges awarded the dance a 35 out of 40.
Ahead of the live show, Robert Irwin had written in an Instagram post that it had “been an emotional week in rehearsals.”

“I’ve been thinking a lot about my mum and her strength, I’ve been reminiscing on the times we’ve spent as a family and how she has kept my dad part of my life,” he captioned his Instagram post, adding, “This dance is for my mum, it’s for anyone who’s lost someone… and it’s for all the strong mothers of the world who deserve our recognition and appreciation.”
His mom had replied, writing, “I love you forever and always. Together we are strong.”
On show day, Robert Irwin posted a video collage on TikTok filled with family video.

“Tonight I dance for my mum, the strongest person I know. My mum and dad created a legacy that I’m proud to continue,” he wrote in the caption. “I hope I can use this dance to share what she means to me, to our family, and to say thank you for always supporting me through life’s ups and downs. See you tonight.”

title: Steve and Terri Irwin's Complete Love Story: A Look Back At Their Relationship
summary: Steve and Terri Irwin shared a love story for the ages.
story: Steve and Terri Irwin shared a love story for the ages.

The “Crocodile Hunter” co-stars and wildlife conservationists tied the knot in 1992 and welcomed two children — Bindi Irwin, 27, and Robert Irwin, 21 — before Steve Irwin died tragically in 2006 at age 44 after being pierced in the chest by a stingray.

Terri Irwin, now 61, continued raising her children as a single mom. Over the years, she’s been candid about her decision to forgo dating after losing her husband, explaining to US Weekly in 2024 that she’d already had her “happily ever after.”

“I had the best marriage in the whole world for 14 years, and I’m very comfortable with the person I see in the mirror,” she told the publication. “So I’m OK to be on my own now. And I’m lonely for Steve, but I’m not a lonely person, so I’m very lucky.”
Here's a look back at Steve and Terri Irwin's relationship.
October 1991: Steve Irwin and Terri Irwin Meet
Steve Irwin met Terri Irwin (neé Raines), who was then an American living in Eugene, Oregon, in October 1991 at the Irwin family's small wildlife park in Beerwah, Queensland, in Australia.
Their first meeting took place just two days after Steve Irwin took over management of the park from his parents who founded it, according to the family's official website.
June 1992: The Couple Tie the Knot ... and Plant the Seeds for 'The Crocodile Hunter'
Less than a year after meeting, the lovebirds tied the knot on June 4, 1992, in Eugene, Oregon, the family website shares.
Rather than go on a honeymoon, the adventurous newlyweds opted to film a wildlife documentary “while relocating a problem crocodile in far north Queensland,” their website says.

The hit documentary inspired the couple’s international wildlife television series “The Crocodile Hunter,” which launched several TV spinoffs and the feature film “The Crocodile Hunter: Collision Course.”
1998: The Couple's Wildlife Park is Renamed the Australia Zoo

The couple decided to change the name of their growing wildlife park to the Australia Zoo to better reflect their shared dream of creating the world’s best zoo, one that emphasized Steve Irwin's message of "Conservation Through Exciting Education,” according to their website.
The Irwin family runs the Australia Zoo to this day.
July 1988: The Couple Welcome Daughter Bindi
Steve and Terri Irwin became parents when their first child, daughter Bindi Irwin, was born on July 24, 1998.

Bindi Irwin, now 27 and the mother of a 4-year-old daughter (with husband Chandler Powell) followed in her parents' professional footsteps and is now a conservationist and zookeeper at the Australia Zoo.
December 2003: They Welcome Their Son Robert
The couple expanded their family when they welcomed their son, Robert Irwin, on Dec. 1, 2003.
Robert Irwin, who is currently heating up the dance floor as a contestant on Season 34 of “Dancing With the Stars,” joined his mother and sister to work at the Australia Zoo.
September 2006: Steve Irwin Dies While Filming a Nature Documentary
Steve Irwin died tragically On Sept. 4 2006 at age 44 after a stingray attacked him while he was filming a nature documentary.
2016: Terri Irwin Reveals She Hasn't Dated Since Her Husband Died
Terri Irwin revealed that she hadn't dated anyone since her late husband's death during a candid interview with Australian Women’s Weekly.
“I haven’t been on a single date since Steve died,” she told the publication.
“If I hadn’t met Steve, I probably would never have married because I wasn’t looking for love when I met him,” she added.
May 2024: Terri Irwin Says She's Not Interested in Dating Again
In May 2024, nearly 18 years after her husband's death, Terri Irwin told US Weekly she didn't plan on ever looking for love again.

“I totally got my happily ever after,” she told US Weekly. “And while there are a lot of wonderful men in the world, can you see another Steve Irwin? I just can’t. I’d be like, ‘I love that you’re a librarian ... but I got to go jump a crocodile and do that.’ Forget that.”
June 2025: Terri Irwin Marks Her 33rd Wedding Anniversary with Steve Irwin
Terri Irwin honored her late husband in June 2025 when she shared a photo from their wedding day on Instagram to mark their 33rd wedding anniversary.
“Today, 33 years ago, Steve and I were married in my grandmother’s church in Oregon. And it was the first day of my happily ever after,” she wrote in her caption.
“Every day I wake up with beautiful memories, so much love in my heart, and the promise of continuing his incredible legacy. I am truly blessed,” she added.
Bindi Irwin shared her love for her mother and father in the comments, writing, “The best parents and true soul mates. Love you both beyond description.”

title: Kate Cassidy Details Her Last 'Long, Heartfelt Goodbye' with Liam Payne
summary: Liam Payne's girlfriend, Kate Cassidy, recalled the last conversation she had with the One Directioner.
story: Liam Payne's girlfriend, Kate Cassidy, recalled the final conversation she had with the former One Directioner in a TikTok video on Oct. 12, posted nearly one year after his death.
“One year ago today was the last day I spent with Liam," she said at the start of the video.
Payne died on Oct. 16, 2024 after falling off of a balcony in a hotel in Buenos Aires, Argentina. He was 31 years old.

The toxicology report found multiple substances in his system at the time of death, according to the Argentinian prosecutor's office. Payne had spoken openly about his struggles with addiction leading up to his death.
Cassidy reflected on the last time she saw Payne in person, and how they had a “long, heartfelt” goodbye.
"The last time I was with Liam in Argentina before I left, the car was in the driveway. I was sitting on the couch expressing to him how much I missed him, how much I love him," she said.
She shared chilling words Payne said in light of what happened next.

"He looked at me and he said, 'You're going to miss your flight. You’re acting like this is the last time you’re ever going to see me again,'" she said. "Little did I know it literally was the last time I got to see him."
She said she's "so, so glad" that she and Payne had that "last goodbye," and hoped her story reminded people to tell their loved ones they love them.
"I know I always say it, but you never know what tomorrow brings," she said.
Payne and Cassidy were first linked in 2022, when they first began appearing at public events together.
Payne, who was from the United Kingdom, and Cassidy, an American influencer, had just purchased a house together in the United States when Payne passed.
"We were starting this new chapter of our life," Cassidy said on Jay Shetty's "On Purpose" podcast.

In 2023, Cassidy posted a TikTok video captioned "the power of manifesting, I guess," detailing how she was a One Direction superfan when she was younger, and just ten years later she was dating one of the band members.
Cassidy, in the video, shows off a popsicle stick where she had drawn a picture of Payne as a child. Then, she opens a door to reveal him laying on a bed.
In August, Cassidy posted a tribute to Payne on what would have been his 32nd birthday.

"My dearest Liam, It breaks my heart being that I can’t hand you a physical birthday card today. That I can’t hear your laugh, or tell you all the things I wish I’d said a thousand more times," she wrote.
In the past year, Cassidy has posted about her journey with loss and continued to commemorate Payne's life.

title: Who Was Adeline Watkins? About Ed Gein's Alleged Girlfriend
summary: Who was Adeline Watkins and what happened to her? This is the true story of Ed Gein's girlfriend and how it compares to what's shown in the series.
story: The newest season of Netflix's "Monster" not only depicts killer Ed Gein and his macabre crimes, it also shows him with a female companion whose role in his life has been disputed.

Charlie Hunnam plays the man who became known as The Butcher of Plainfield for the grisly crimes uncovered at his Wisconsin farm in 1957. Gein admitted to killing two local women and robbing graves at a local cemetery to make ghoulish items like bowls, lampshades and upholstered chairs out of human skin and bone.
In "Monster: The Ed Gein Story," actor Suzanna Son plays a woman named Adeline Watkins, who appears to be Gein’s girlfriend and a woman who shares some of his interest in gruesome murders.
Was she a real person? Here's what to know.
Who Was Adeline Watkins?

Following Gein's arrest in 1957, a local woman from Gein's hometown of Plainfield named Adeline Watkins gave an interview with the Minneapolis Tribune, which was reprinted in the Wisconsin State Journal on Nov. 21, 1957, saying Gein once proposed to her.
Watkins, who was 50 years old at the time, described Gein as "good and kind and sweet" in the article.
She claimed the two had a 20-year romance and that Gein "was so nice about doing things I wanted to do that sometimes I felt I was taking advantage of him."
"I loved him and I still do," she added.
She was described by the reporter as "a plain woman with graying bangs and horn-rimmed glasses."
Watkins said her last date with Gein was on Feb. 6, 1955, about two years before he was arrested. She claimed that Gein didn't explicitly propose to her that night, but she "knew what he meant."
"I turned him down, but not because there was anything wrong with him," she continued. "It was something wrong with me. I guess I was afraid I wouldn't be able to live up to what he expected of me."
Watkins' mother was also quoted saying Gein was a "sweet, polite man" who always had her daughter home by 10 p.m. from a date.
Watkins added that she and Gein often talked about books, including his favorites about lions, tigers, Africa and India. She said they also loved true crime.
"I guess we discussed every murder we ever heard about," she said. "Eddie told how the murdered did wrong, what mistakes he had made. I thought it was interesting."
What Did Ed Gein Say About His Relationship with Adeline Watkins?
Gein never publicly made any mention of Watkins.
In the book "Unhinged" by Robert Keller, Gein was described as a "lonely old bachelor" whom local farmers' wives took pity on and delivered meals and cookies to him at his farm.
Watkins said in the Minneapolis Tribune that she and Gein went on dates to the movies or a local tavern. She said she had to "drag" Gein into a tavern because he did not drink.

However, one of the women Gein admitted to murdering was a tavern owner, Mary Hogan. He frequently visited her establishment and looked at her as a "mirror image of his sainted mother," according to "Unhinged." It's unclear whether Watkins and Gein ever visited Hogan's tavern or if they were ever truly a couple.
Following his arrest, Gein lived in state psychiatric facilities until his death in 1984.

While growing up under their mother's domineering presence, Gein and his brother were warned constantly by their mother about the immorality of women and told to avoid them. Neither of them ever married, and Ed Gein remained obsessed with his mother until her death and beyond.
Adeline Watkins Retracted Her Statements
Watkins' interview with the Minnesota paper was picked up by The Associated Press and made national headlines for her alleged love affair with a ghoulish murderer and grave robber.
She then spoke to the local Stevens Point Journal in Wisconsin for a story that ran on Dec. 3, 1957, and denied some of her previous statements.

Watkins said there was no 20-year romance between the two, only that she had known him for 20 years. She said she had only spent time with him during a seven-month period in 1954 and went to a few shows at a local theater and spent time with him at her home. She said she never visited his home.
She denied that she or her mother had referred to Gein as "sweet" in the interview. She also denied saying she had to "practically drag" Gein into a local tavern.

Outside of the two newspaper stories, Watkins did not speak publicly about Gein again. She died at 85 in 1992 and was buried in the Plainfield Cemetery in Wisconsin. It's one of the cemeteries where Gein admitted to digging up corpses in the 1940s and '50s.
How is Adeline Watkins Portrayed in 'Monster'?
Son portrays Watkins as Gein's girlfriend in the Netflix series. It also shows her as complicit in his crimes. There is no evidence of that ever happening.

Son's character shows him photos of Holocaust victims and notorious Nazi war criminal Ilse Koch, and then Gein shows her the hair-raising items he made out of human body parts. She is shown a bowl made of a skull, a belt made out of women's nipples and a chair upholstered with human skin, all of which were real items found by authorities at Gein's home in Plainfield, Wisconsin.

He also introduces Son's character to his "mother," which is really a corpse of his late mother sitting in a chair with her back to Watkins like a scene straight out of "Psycho," which was inspired by Gein's crimes. Adeline then promptly leaves.
Gein denied digging up the body of his mother, Augusta Gein, who died of a stroke in 1945.

In a later episode, the two are seen at a graveyard, where Watkins accepts a wedding proposal from Gein. She is then shown wanting to have sex with him, but he stops her because he's been taught by his mother that sex is only for procreation.

The two are then shown moving in together, and Watkins is depicted as having a morbid fascination when she finds the corpse of one of Gein's victims. Yet another disturbing scene shows Watkins photographing corpses mutilated by Gein and encouraging necrophilia.
None of these events appear to have happened, according to police reports, interviews with Gein and the interviews with Watkins.

In perhaps a nod to the Minneapolis Tribune interview by Watkins, Son's character is later shown seeking media attention to grab the spotlight after Gein's crimes have been made public. In the final episode, she meets with Gein in his psychiatric hospital and confesses to disturbing urges.
Neither Gein nor Watkins ever spoke of any meeting between them while Gein was in the hospital.

title: HGTV Announces Cast for ‘Bachelor Mansion Takeover.’ See the List of Former Contestants
summary: Who is in the cast of Bachelor Mansion Takeover? See who is in the cast and where you know them from.
story: The Bachelor Nation and HGTV crossover event officially has a cast, and they are headed back to the iconic “Bachelor” mansion.
In May, HGTV announced that it was teaming up with the reality dating show franchise to launch a new series featuring Bachelor Nation alums.

On Oct. 14, the network officially announced the name of the show — “Bachelor Mansion Takeover” — and revealed that famous faces from “The Bachelor,” “The Bachelorette,” “The Golden Bachelor” and “The Golden Bachelorette” will compete and serve as judges on the upcoming renovation series.

HGTV explained in a press release that 12 Bachelor Nation contestants will return to the “Bachelor” mansion, the grand property located in Agoura Hills, California, where the first-night limo entrances are held, for the six-episode series hosted by Jesse Palmer. The contestants will transform different spaces on the property, including “never-before-seen rooms.”
Every episode, the 12 competitors will “swap roses for paintbrushes and cocktail attire for overalls in weekly elimination challenges,” the press release said.
Former “Bachelorette” Season 16 lead Tayshia Adams and “Bachelorette” Season 15 fan-favorite Tyler Cameron will judge the designs each episode alongside different guest judges.
The following alums, who are described as having “expert renovation skills,” will compete for the cash prize of $100,000:

Dean Bell (“The Bachelorette” Season 13, “Bachelor in Paradise” Seasons 4 and 6 and “The Bachelor Winter Games”)Jill Chin (“The Bachelor” Season 26 and “Bachelor in Paradise” Seasons 8 and 10) Noah Erb (“The Bachelorette” Season 16 and “Bachelor in Paradise” Season 7)Allyshia Gupta (“The Bachelor” Season 29 and “Bachelor in Paradise” Season 10)Tammy Ly (“The Bachelor” Season 26 and “Bachelor in Paradise” Season 7)Sandra Mason (“The Golden Bachelor” Season 1) Sam McKinney (“The Bachelorette” Season 21 and “Bachelor in Paradise Season 10) Brendan Morais (“The Bachelorette” Season 16 and “Bachelor in Paradise” Season 7)Courtney Robertson Preciado (“The Bachelor” Season 16) Jeremy Simon (“The Bachelorette” Season 21 and “Bachelor in Paradise” Season 10)Christopher Stallworth (“The Golden Bachelorette” Season 1) Joan Vassos (“The Golden Bachelor” Season 1 and “The Golden Bachelorette” Season 1)

Jeremy Simon (“The Bachelorette” Season 21 and “Bachelor in Paradise” Season 10)
Christopher Stallworth (“The Golden Bachelorette” Season 1)
Joan Vassos (“The Golden Bachelor” Season 1 and “The Golden Bachelorette” Season 1)
“Bachelor Mansion Takeover” will premiere in 2026, the network confirmed in the press release.

“When we learned the Bachelor Mansion needed a serious makeover, we knew only HGTV could give the iconic property a renovation worthy of the name," Howard Lee, the chief creative officer of U.S. networks of Warner Bros. Discovery, said in a statement,
He added that he “can’t wait to see what (the contestants) get up to in this first of its kind competition for the network.”
Warner Bros. Discovery previously announced that the show will air on HGTV and also be available to stream on HBO Max.

title: Reese Witherspoon Raves About Diane Keaton's Mentorship Following Now-Viral Tribute: ‘She Nurtured Me’
summary: Reese Witherspoon explained how Diane Keaton helped launch her career and always checked in on her after that.
story: Reese Witherspoon continues to mourn the death of Diane Keaton after praising the late Oscar winner in a now-viral video.

Keaton, who died at the age of 79, directed Witherspoon in the 1991 TV-movie “Wildflower.” It was the second on-screen acting credit for Witherspoon and came at a time when Keaton had already established herself as a Hollywood icon.
“She was the second director who ever took a chance on me… I was from nowhere,” Witherspoon said on Oct. 14 while appearing on TODAY with Jenna & Friends.
“And she was like, ‘You’re special.’ And I was like, ‘I am?’ And she nurtured me. She kept checking in on me, making sure I felt safe, that was I making the right business decisions.”

Keaton was a star on the big screen and is known as an onscreen mom to many.
